description:
Emsi is hiring a results-driven Account Executive who is passionate about customer success in the University market. We are looking for someone who will combine exceptional leadership and quantitative analysis skills, with the ability to work effectively in a highly dynamic environment. 

As an Account Executive, you will be responsible for generating revenue via the phone and in-person visits with decision makers at Higher Education institutions.  This will involve focusing on driving new market share by prospecting, developing, maintaining and closing business with clients in a defined territory.

You should be highly-organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to manage multiple competing priorities. Furthermore, it is important that you display excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills.
job_responsibilities:
• Building relationships in our University sector
  • Discovering opportunities to serve potential clients via phone, travel, email and other creative approaches
  • Making use of creativity and analysis to craft and deliver highly relevant presentations
  • Learning and implementing the economic concepts, which relate to our services and the situation of our clients
  • Mentoring less experienced reps
  • Defining and implementing goals that are critical to the success of the organization
specific_qualifications:
• Bachelor’s Degree, preferred
  • Minimum of 3 years of work experience; proven sales experience, preferred
  • Proven experience in conceptual sales, solution selling and value-based selling, preferred
  • Proven experience with performance based compensation structure, preferred
  • Proven experience with cold calling, preferred
  • Proficiency working with MS Office Suite, particularly Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Willingness to travel

description: Provide top notch customer service experience and maximize customer success with our products. In carrying out the objective of this position, a successful candidate will be committed to our values by working to bless the customer, bless the employee, and bless the shareholder.
job_responsibilities:
• Maintain a strong working knowledge of HE customers at every level of their organization (from decision makers to researchers) and ensure they are equipped with the knowledge, data and tools needed to form and execute their vision.
  • Identify growth opportunities within the institution and communicate those opportunities with sales and consulting teams.
  • Negotiate, document and invoice renewals with clients.
  • Coordinate the implementation of new subscriptions.
  • Provide ongoing training and consultation to clients.
  • Make meaningful contact quarterly (minimum) with every client.
  • Plan strategic location trips to meet with clients at their organization (e.g. travel to Phoenix and meet with all clients in the area).
    • Establish client specific goals for every client with metrics for success.
specific_qualifications:
• Ability to maintain a high level of activity, manage multiple competing priorities, and work effectively in a competitive, results-driven culture.
  • Ability to positively adapt to change in a highly dynamic work environment.
  • Experience working on a performance-based compensation structure highly desired.
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication, presentation, and time management skills.
  • Highly proficient in using the internet and all MS Office programs, particularly Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Strong qualitative and quantitative analysis skills.

description:
Position Overview

We are looking for talented Business Development Reps who will help us find and develop new client relationships.  The BDR will work with our sales team and develop leads for our Account Executives through outbound marketing and messaging to targeted accounts.  We value integrity, intelligence, good humor, and a professional who wants to learn, grow, and earn.  Successful performers will be first in line for promotion to a closing role.
job_responsibilities:
• Prospect into a defined account list via phone, email, social selling, and other creative approaches.
  • Represent our values while conducting business with the highest level of honesty and integrity.
  • Help potential customers see and define the scope of the issues in their businesses, and position our software solutions to enable these organizations to enact real change.
  • Use research, creativity, and analysis to craft and deliver relevant messaging at the opportune time.
  • Work independently without constant oversight
  • Have personality, be comfortable, enjoy our culture, be competitive
specific_qualifications:
• Willing to learn and be coached – we will mentor, develop, and train you
  • You work hard to win, and hate to lose
  • Energetic, optimistic, and entrepreneurial
  • Desire to work in a mature, sophisticated, professional, and fun sales culture
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Bachelor’s degree desired, but not necessary

description:
Emsi is the leader in Enterprise big data analytics, delivering our software solutions to support mission-critical decisions for our clients.  Visit us at www.economicmodeling.com.
 
We are looking for talented Account Executives who will help us develop long-term client relationships within defined multi-state territories.  In this role you will develop and close new business through your own prospecting as well as through our partner/channel environment.  Our territories are massive, and the opportunity for growth and quota retirement are real.  We value hunger, intelligence, and a professional who conducts business with impeccable integrity.
job_responsibilities:
• Prospect into enterprise accounts via phone, email, social selling, and other creative approaches.
  • Build positive professional relationships with clients while working in collaboration with internal team members in marketing, consulting, customer-service and product development, in order to provide impressive solutions leading to impressive results for our clients.
  • Help potential customers see and define the scope of the issues in their business and deliver software and consulting solutions that empower these organizations to enact real change.
  • Use research, creativity, and analysis to craft and deliver highly relevant presentations to clients via online meetings or by means of travel to on-site meetings and conferences.
  • Learn and use the economic and data concepts that relate to our services and the situations of our clients.
  • Generate sales through outbound prospecting, channel sales, and inbound leads
  • Effectively mentor and guide your assigned Business Development Rep to help generate leads
  • Some travel required
specific_qualifications:
• 1-3 years experience with consultative and solution-based software sales preferred
  • Demonstrated history of quota achievement in a competitive environment
  • Energetic, optimistic, and entrepreneurial
  • Desire to work in a mature, sophisticated, and professional sales culture
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Ability to positively adapt to change in a highly dynamic work environment
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication, presentation, and time management skills
  • Bachelor’s degree highly desired

description:
Emsi is a fast-growing labor market data and analytics company headquartered in Moscow, Idaho. We are looking to hire a full-time attorney to join our in-house legal team. 

In this role, you will report to Emsi’s General Counsel, and will work directly with Emsi’s sales and client-services teams – as well as legal, procurement, and leadership within client and vendor organizations – to draft, review, and negotiate commercial contracts. You will also draft and review internal employment and policy documents, and assist Emsi’s General Counsel and Contract Manager in managing Emsi’s client, vendor, and internal legal documents. 

Because Emsi is a fast-growing company (we are moving into a newly-built corporate headquarters in Moscow ID in December 2020), you will have abundant opportunities to expand your responsibilities as Corporate Counsel. Emsi’s General Counsel serves the day-to-day contract needs of Emsi’s sales and client services operations, but also serves the important role of trusted advisor in many aspects of Emsi’s business, including strategic planning and decision making, internal policymaking, and personnel management. So, as a member of Emsi’s legal team, you will have frequent opportunities to grow both your legal and corporate career experience as you contribute to Emsi’s success in all facets of the business. 

Emsi legal takes seriously the company’s foundational commitment to bless Emsi’s customers, employees, and shareholders. If you are interested in being an important part of that mission, please apply below.
job_responsibilities:
• Licensed to practice law in a U.S. jurisdiction and ability to obtain Idaho house counsel license (full Idaho license not required) 
  • Excellent drafting skills (ability to draft clear and concise contract terms at volume)
  • Excellent written communication skills (especially the ability to quickly compose clear and concise emails)
  • Customer-service mindset (Emsi legal exists to help internal “customers” and external customers – legal should never present an unnecessary roadblock to anyone else doing their job)
  • Flexibility (your job will generally be as described above, but you will be expected to contribute how and where you can serve Emsi best – even if that doesn’t fit strictly within your job description)  
  • Excellent attitude
specific_qualifications: • Particular consideration will be given to applicants with expertise in labor and employment law

description: We are looking for a highly motivated data engineer who will find optimal ways to process and enrich messy user-submitted data which will help us better answer questions about the workforce, educational programs, and job opportunities. In carrying out the objective of this position, a successful candidate will be committed to our values by working to bless the customer, bless the employee, and bless the shareholder.
job_responsibilities:
• Be familiar with our data clients, both in-house and external, and determine how best to get our data into their tools.
  • Build and maintain data processing pipelines for several major data sources for job postings and professional profiles.
  • Create and preserve knowledge with well-written documentation.
  • Maintain Elasticsearch clusters and the servers they run on.
specific_qualifications: • This position reports to the Senior Director of Data Innovation.

description: Emsi is looking for a Data Engineer to work on the Web Scraping team. In carrying out the objective of this position, a successful candidate will be committed to our values by working to bless the customer, bless the employee, and bless the shareholder
job_responsibilities:
• Create and improve processes, tools, workflows, and resilient data architecture to scrape web content.  
  • Manage data accuracy and quality. 
  • Identify and rectify any issues with breaks as well as scale scrapers as needed.
specific_qualifications: • This position reports to the Senior Director of Data Innovation.

description: The Economic Analyst at Emsi works with the Higher Education (HE) Consulting team to produce innovative datasets, data models, visualizations, and reports that answer our clients’ most pressing problems. A successful candidate will bring a passion for finding creative ways to apply data to solve client problems by developing and bringing to market actionable insights. In carrying out the objective of this position, a successful candidate will be committed to our values by working to bless the customer, bless the employee, and bless the shareholder.
job_responsibilities:
• Conduct quantitative analysis using Emsi data and other data sources to research, model, and report solutions for colleges and universities.
  • Collaborate with the Director of Higher Education Consulting and team members to scope, build, and deliver standard and custom reports.
  • Document methodology and findings of the quantitative analyses, with the added ability of simplifying and interpreting the findings to a variety of audiences.
  • Communicate with clients the findings of the analyses, including how to use the findings to make data-driven decisions.
specific_qualifications:
• Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong analytical skills.
  • Strong quality assurance skills with attention to detail in both quantitative analyses and technical writing.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and Google Suite with advanced skills in Excel.
  • Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team environment.
  • Creative problem-solving skills and the ability to look at the numbers, trends, and data to derive conclusions based on findings.
  • Ability to compose written analyses that explain complex economic concepts in simple terms.

description:
The Financial Analyst is part of the Emsi finance team and plays a crucial role in our execution of growth initiatives and constant innovation around optimizing and evaluating existing revenue and expenditure. Success in the role will require a mastery of our culture, history and operating principles to help ensure
robust and thorough analysis and prevent flawed analytical results even if “technically correct.” Forms of data involved in this role are not limited to financial but will also include a wide array of operational and HR data with qualitative information and insights. The operating principle for all analysis will be production
of meaningful and true analysis, never reducing to the production of numbers to support decisions stakeholders have already made. In carrying out the objective of this position, a successful candidate will be committed to our values by working to bless the customer, bless the employee, and bless the
shareholder.
job_responsibilities:
• Maintain a working knowledge of Emsi’s various products and services. 
  • Produce monthly slide decks for Emsi and BUs (typically within 3 working days of month end). 
  • Schedule BU meetings to occur within 7 working days of month end. 
  • Attend BU meetings with (a) ability to comment on any apparent data anomalies or reasonable questions and (b) mechanism to record any agreed changes / developments and implement immediately so that the same request is not needed twice. 
  • Coordinate development and production of any special slide decks whether part of the monthly BU meetings or separately (e.g. BU renewals, sales, product trajectories, cost areas, etc.).
  • Organize data and records, and capably record the results of decisions and discussions so that leadership can rely on your work while assessing success of growth investments.
  • Produce scopes for any analytics requests, to be agreed to with your manager before performing an analytics request. This process is to be used for all requests even from those higher up the org chart than your manager (e.g. CEO, parent company, investors). 
  • Quarterly review of product catalogue in SalesForce with product and business leaders to ensure obsolete products are removed and new products are included, with any additions or removals being approved by COO and CEO.
  • Perform required seasonal reporting to assist in launch of new markets, products or similar, which may include weekly cadence of reporting; looking to transition such projects into the typical workflow when increased cadence no longer provides significant value. 
  • Play a special role in the annual budget process and periodic forecast updates throughout the year, coordinating such efforts with colleagues on the financial accounting team.
  • Complete special projects as assigned (e.g. tracking costs related to a grant, or potential insurance and/or legal claim.)
  • Pursue professional development so that your current abilities and experiences do not define the upper limit on what you can contribute to Emsi. This could include advocating for formal professional development but will also include spending time learning from those you are connected with professionally, such as at Emsi’s parent company. 
  • Collaborate with IT and others in finance to assist in evaluating and implementing analytical tools and systems with foresight to articulate deficiencies that hold you back from success.
specific_qualifications: • The Financial Analyst reports directly to the Controller and also works closely with COO/CFO and other stakeholders including BU Leaders, Product, Marketing, Sales and Customer Service Leaders, Sr. Financial Analyst at Parent Company and/or other designated representatives at Parent Company or other investors and Emsi board members.

description:
Emsi is a trusted advisor on labor market information for customers across a wide array of markets. We build SaaS products that combine many different kinds of workforce data to accurately inform our clients’ decisions about college course offerings, hiring, site selection, economic development, and much more. We need an experienced developer to join us in producing premier software tools for understanding labor market data. 

If you’re ready to join a high-functioning team of full stack devs working closely with product managers, data engineers, and designers to create interfaces and visualizations that make nuanced data intelligible, we’d love to hear from you. Applicants to this posting will be considered for positions on the Analyst, CareerCoach, and SkillsMatch development teams.
job_responsibilities:
• Team oriented and ready to work closely with other developers
  • Comfortable with working in rapid development cycles
  • Skilled oral and written communicators
  •  Enthusiastic for learning
  • Prepared to contribute at a strategic level to engineering excellence discussions from day one
specific_qualifications:
• Two years of experience with React development in a production environment
  • Two years or more experience with server-side languages like PHP, Python, or Node
  • One or more years of experience managing production environments in AWS
  • Working knowledge of structured databases, e.g. MySQL, PostgreSQL

description: In this role you would work with the Marketing team to produce data visualizations, infographics, and page layouts. This role will primarily involve the design and layout of Economic Impact Studies for the higher ed consulting team but can transition into additional design and layout opportunities. A successful candidate will bring a desire to learn, a strict attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines, a basic understanding of translating numbers into graphs and charts, and an eye for page design and typography.
job_responsibilities:
• Produce and design both long and short documents using existing templates in Adobe InDesign
  • Create graphs and charts, primarily using the Chartwell font
  • Edit photos, create simple data visualizations, and design additional web graphics or page layouts as needed
specific_qualifications: • This position reports to our Chief Innovation Officer and works closely with the Higher Education consulting team.

description: In this role you would work with the Marketing team to produce corporate design pieces such as blog graphics, product brochures, PowerPoint presentations, data visualizations, etc. Due to the wide variety of project types, this role requires a broad knowledge of design principles and tools, as well as an eagerness to learn and develop new skills.
job_responsibilities:
• Assist Corporate Marketing team members with graphics needs
  • Meet weekly with Design team to collaborate and strategize
  • Create effective graphics that follow Emsi’s brand guidelines
specific_qualifications: • This position reports to our Chief Innovation Officer.
